head.supplied: ¶ [A letter from Dr Mueller ¶ suggesting that the Council should endeavour to obtain the services of not less than 10 men and an overseer for not less than one month from the immigration depot beyon...

div.p: To the Council of the Philosophical Institute of Victoria
MS 11663, Royal Society of Victoria, Records 1854-1982, box 1, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

Letter not found. Item is part of the minutes of the meeting of the Council of the Philosophical Institute, 3 November 1858.
[A letter from Dr Mueller
M was Vice-President of the Institute at the time but did not attend this meeting. suggesting that the Council should endeavour to obtain the services of not less than 10 men and an overseer for not less than one month from the immigration depot beyond Princes Bridge, with the view of preparing the ground of the Institute for ornamentation by shrubs &c. was received]
The Secretary, J. Macadam, was 'instructed to communicate with Dr Eades’. The Institute had recently been granted the triangular block of land on the north edge of the town on which it was to erect its permanent home. Eades was both a member of the Institute and a City Councillor.
